definition: to be full of/to flood/to congest
to fill/to satisfy/to fulfill/to act in place of/substitute/sufficient/full
to blame/to reprove/to reprimand/to expel/to oust/to reconnoiter/(of territory) to expand/saline marsh

sentences.english: Residents fled smack into the plume of air carrying radioactive debris.
sentences.chinese: 他们直接逃进了空气中充斥着核碎片的地区。

sentences.english: We've become a country filled with air fresheners.
sentences.chinese: 我们的国家到处充斥着空气清新剂。

sentences.english: I sat down and my mind 12)triggered off dull thuds of depression.
sentences.chinese: 坐了下来，脑子里突然充斥着抑郁的感觉。

sentences.english: A serious political speech should not be full of frivolities .
sentences.chinese: 一篇严肃的政治演讲不该充斥着轻薄无聊的话。

sentences.english: Television is jammed with commercials for antidepressants.
sentences.chinese: 电视上充斥着抗抑郁药的商业广告。

sentences.english: Ithas come to it I accept it all flooded.
sentences.chinese: 但来到它，我接受了它的一切充斥。

sentences.english: The putrid odor of rotting meat flooded the corridors.
sentences.chinese: 腐烂的肉类腐烂的气味充斥走廊。

sentences.english: This is an aqua blue again with a dynamic elf.
sentences.chinese: 这是一个水蓝色小精灵再次充斥活气。

sentences.english: We've become a nation of wussies.
sentences.chinese: 我们已经变成一个充斥软脚虾的国家。

sentences.english: One thinks of nature as "red in tooth and claw, " as the old saying goes.
sentences.chinese: 有人认为正如一句古话，自然界充斥着腥牙血爪。
商业化的图书充斥市场。

sentences.english: The word-wide-web is swarmed with much detrimental information.
sentences.chinese: 互联网上充斥着很多有害信息。

sentences.english: I sat down and my mind triggered off dull thuds of depression.
sentences.chinese: 坐了下来，脑子里突然充斥着抑郁的感觉。

sentences.english: His new novel plumbs the depths of violence.
Astronomers suspected that the low-density gas permeates the filaments of the web.
sentences.chinese: 天文学家怀疑低密度气体充斥在这个丝网之中。

sentences.english: A city with such immense houses could never be called small.
sentences.chinese: 充斥着庞屋巨室的城市，是没法称之为“小”的。

definition: to overflow (with riches)/replete
to pervade/to fill the air/diffuse/everywhere present/about to inundate (water)/permeated by (smoke)/filled with (dust)/to saturate (the air with fog, smoke etc)
variant of 彌漫|弥漫[mi2 man4]
full of/brimming with/very full/permeated
to mix
to dissipate everywhere (of light, sound, gas etc)
to mix together (disparate substances)/to mingle/a mix/to be tangled up with
lit. sth hits one in the face/directly in one's face/sth assaults the senses/blatant (advertising)/eye-catching/(a smell) assaults the nostrils
to engulf/to sweep/to carry away everything
to be everywhere
to distribute/to emit/to issue
to mix/to mingle
to be full of/completely
to sweep along/to coerce
lit. hiding the sky and covering the earth (idiom); fig. earth-shattering/omnipresent/of universal importance
to interweave
to be covered with/to be filled with
